content: up round k1 mark this stitch as the centre stitch for the heel k1 m1 k1 place m-1 end of heel k no of side stitches place m-2 start of toe k1 m1 k1 k1 mark this stitch as the centre stitch for the toe k1 m1 k1 place m-3 end of toe k no of side stitches place m-4 start of heel k1 m1 k1 4stitchesincreased-totalnumberofstitches caston+4 stitchesbetweenheelmarkers 7 stitchesbetweentoemarkers 7 rounds 1-8 start chart 1 at stitch 25 this is the centre stitch and work chart 1 to m-1 k to m-2 work chart 1 to m-3 k to m-4 work chart 1 up to stitch 24 slipping markers as you reach them 40stitchesincreased­totalnumberofstitches caston+44 stitchesbetweenheelmarkers 27 stitchesbetweentoemarkers 27 round 9 work all double stitches as one single stitch start chart 1 at row 9 stitch 25 this is the centre stitch and work chart 1 to m-1 sm k to m-2 sm work chart 1 to m-3 sm k10 turn slip first stitch purlwise with yarn in front pull the yarn over the needle so a double stitch is formed purl back to marker m-3 sm work row 10 of chart 1 this is all purl stitches to next marker m-2 sm purl 10 turn slip first stich purlwise with yarn in front pull the yarn over the needle so a double stitch is formed k to marker m-2 sm work row 11 of chart 1 to marker m-3 sm k to marker m-4 sm work row 9 of chart 1 up to stitch 24 the colourwork and adjust the bor so it will be at the side of the sock remove the heel and toe markers leave the centre markers in place sock 1 not quite a whole round k5 *m1 k10* - repeat section between ** to centre toe stitch count how many stitches you worked since last m1 e g 2 stitches k centre stitch k counted number of stitches *m1 k10* to 15/17/19 stitches before centre heel stitch this is your new bor place a marker sock 2 a bit more than one complete round k5 *m1 k10* - repeat section between ** to centre toe stitch count how many stitches you worked since last m1 e g 2
